meanings.definition: Covered in a thick, sticky substance
meanings.sent1: The candy became ickier after being left out in the sun.
meanings.sent2: The slime on the pond was getting ickier by the minute.
meanings.sent3: The ickier syrup dripped slowly down the sides of the pancake stack.
meanings.sent4: The mud on the trail clung to my shoes like an ickier version of glue.
meanings.sent5: The ickier mess on the kitchen counter was a nightmare to clean up.

meanings.definition: Causing a feeling of disgust or revulsion
meanings.sent1: The smell from the garbage can was getting ickier every day.
meanings.sent2: The rotten food in the fridge was starting to smell ickier than ever.
meanings.sent3: The ickier odor coming from the old socks made everyone cringe.
meanings.sent4: The ickier sight of the overflowing trash bin made me want to leave the room.
meanings.sent5: The ickier taste of the spoiled milk made me gag instantly.

meanings.definition: More unpleasant or repulsive than something else
meanings.sent1: The ickier smell of the sewer was overpowering in the alley.
meanings.sent2: The ickier taste of the medicine made it hard to swallow.
meanings.sent3: The ickier appearance of the old, moldy bread made me lose my appetite.
meanings.sent4: The ickier texture of the slimy fish was enough to make me shudder.
meanings.sent5: The ickier sound of the buzzing flies was driving me crazy.
